snippet: On Wednesday night, Wall Street took part in the 35th annual Empire State Building Run-Up, a charity event that had 666 people racing up the 1,576 stairs of the tallest building in New York.
abstract: On Wednesday night, Wall Street took part in the 35th annual Empire State Building Run-Up, a charity event that had 666 people racing up the 1,576 stairs of the tallest building in New York.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street bankers are used to living and working in Manhattan skyscrapers. But unless the power goes out, most aren't used to taking the stairs.

headline.main: For Once, a Bank Run Is a Good Thing
